title: Service is a gift for Aiken Mid-Day Lions
title_page: Service is a gift for Aiken Mid-Day Lions
maintext:
Honoring administrative professionals is what the Aiken Mid-Day Lions annual luncheon is all about.
This is the 22nd year the Mid-Day Lions been having the luncheon, said President Lion Joanne Cadotte.
The club’s theme this year is “Service is a Gift,” and partnering with an organization to help individuals is the gift that club members, as Lions, receive, she said.
After the luncheon, there was a fashion show with the models being from various organizations the Mid-Day Lions support; the fashions were courtesy of Affordables.
There was also a silent auction, door prizes and Aiken County Councilman Andrew Siders, who was Master of Ceremonies, serenaded the crowd of mostly women.
“We couldn’t support the causes we do without our sponsors,” Cadotte added. “The proceeds from this function today funds the organizations the Mid-Day Lions support.”
